Immortality: If humans could change their biological age at will, they could theoretically live forever. This would have a profound impact on society, culture, and the environment. It would also raise ethical questions about the value of life and the responsibility of individuals and society to use this power responsibly.

Aging Reversal: Humans could potentially reverse their biological age, allowing them to regain their youth and vitality. This could have a significant impact on healthcare and medicine, as well as on the way we view aging and the elderly.
Longevity: Humans could increase their lifespan significantly by changing their biological age. This could have a major impact on the workforce, social structures, and the economy.

Time Travel: If humans could change their biological age at will, they could potentially travel through time. This would have a profound impact on our understanding of the universe and our place in it.

Evolution: Humans could potentially use their ability to change their biological age to evolve and adapt to new environments. This could have a major impact on the future of humanity and the evolution of the species as a whole.
